00020 #include <stdlib.h>
00021 #include <string.h>
00022 #include <ccn/charbuf.h>
00023 #include <ccn/flatname.h>
00024 #define CCN_NAMETREE_IMPL
00025 #include <ccn/nametree.h>
00026 
00027 #define CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH 16
00028 #define NAMETREE_PVT_PAYLOAD_OWNED 0x40
00029 
00030 /**
00031  *  Create a new, empty nametree
00032  *
00033  * The initial_limit is the number of entries that may be
00034  * inserted before growing the table.
00035  */
00036 struct ccn_nametree *
00037 ccn_nametree_create(int initial_limit)
00038 {
00039     struct ccn_nametree *h;
00040     ccn_cookie c;
00041     
00042     if (initial_limit < 6)
00043         initial_limit = 6;
00044     h = calloc(1, sizeof(*h));
00045     if (h != NULL) {
00046         h->n = 0;
00047         h->head = ccny_create(0, 0);
00048         if (h->head == NULL) {
00049             free(h);
00050             return(NULL);
00051         }
00052         if (h->head->skipdim != CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH) abort();
00053         h->head->skipdim = 1;
00054         h->head->skiplinks[0] = NULL;
00055         for (c = (~0U) / 2; c / 2 - c / 8 > initial_limit;)
00056             c = c / 2;
00057         h->cookiemask = c;
00058         h->limit = c - c / 4;
00059         h->nmentry_by_cookie = calloc(c + 1, sizeof(struct ccny *));
00060         if (h->nmentry_by_cookie == NULL) {
00061             free(h->head);
00062             free(h);
00063             return(NULL);
00064         }
00065         h->data = NULL;
00066         h->post_enroll = 0;
00067         h->pre_remove = 0;
00068         h->check = 0;
00069         h->finalize = 0;
00070         h->compare = &ccn_flatname_compare;
00071     }
00072     return(h);
00073 }
00074 
00075 /**
00076  *  Create a new nametree entry, not hooked up to anything
00077  *
00078  * The skiplinks array needs to be sized with an appropriate random
00079  * distribution; for this purpose the caller must provide a word of
00080  * random bits.
00081  *
00082  * If payload_size is non-zero, extra zero-initialized space will
00083  * be allocated, and a pointer to it provided in the payload field.
00084  * This will be automatically freed when the entry is destroyed.
00085  *
00086  * If the payload size is zero, the caller assumes resonsibility
00087  * for managing the payload memory, probably by providing a suitable
00088  * finalize action.
00089  */
00090 struct ccny *
00091 ccny_create(unsigned randombits, size_t payload_size)
00092 {
00093     struct ccny *y = NULL;
00094     int d;
00095     unsigned rb;
00096     size_t base_size;
00097     
00098     for (d = 1, rb = randombits; d < CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH; d++, rb >>= 2)
00099         if ((rb & 3) != 0) break;
00100     base_size = sizeof(*y) + (d - 1) * sizeof(y->skiplinks[0]);
00101     if (payload_size > 0)
00102         base_size = (base_size + 7) / 8 * 8; /* 8-byte alignment */
00103     y = calloc(1, base_size + payload_size);
00104     if (y == NULL)
00105         return(y);
00106     y->cookie = 0;
00107     y->prev = NULL;
00108     y->payload = NULL;
00109     y->skipdim = d;
00110     if (payload_size > 0) {
00111         y->payload = ((unsigned char *)y) + base_size;
00112         y->prv |= NAMETREE_PVT_PAYLOAD_OWNED;
00113     }
00114     return(y);
00115 }
00116 
00117 /**
00118  *  Set the key in a nametree entry
00119  *
00120  * This makes a copy.  The entry must not be in a nametree.
00121  * Any old key is freed before making the copy.
00122  *
00123  * A client may choose to manage the key storage differently,
00124  * but in such a case it must provide a finalize action that
00125  * leaves y->key NULL.
00126  *
00127  * @returns -1 for error, 0 for success.
00128  */
00129 int
00130 ccny_set_key(struct ccny *y, const unsigned char *key, size_t size)
00131 {
00132     if (size >= (~0U) / 2)
00133         return(-1);
00134     if (y->cookie != 0)
00135         return(-1);
00136     if (y->key != NULL) {
00137         free(y->key);
00138         y->key = NULL;
00139         y->keylen = 0;
00140     }
00141     if (key == NULL)
00142         return(0);
00143     y->key = malloc(size);
00144     if (y->key == NULL)
00145         return(-1);
00146     memcpy(y->key, key, size);
00147     y->keylen = size;
00148     return(0);
00149 }
00150 
00151 /**
00152  *  Directly assign the key and keylen in a nametree entry
00153  *
00154  *  This is for clients that are handling their own memory management.
00155  */
00156 
00157 void
00158 ccny_set_key_fields(struct ccny *y, unsigned char *key, unsigned size)
00159 {
00160     y->key = key;
00161     y->keylen = size;
00162 }
00163 
00164 /**
00165  *  Look up an entry, given a cookie.
00166  */
00167 struct ccny *
00168 ccny_from_cookie(struct ccn_nametree *h, ccn_cookie cookie)
00169 {
00170     struct ccny *ans;
00171     
00172     ans = h->nmentry_by_cookie[cookie & h->cookiemask];
00173     if (ans != NULL && ans->cookie == cookie)
00174         return(ans);
00175     return(NULL);
00176 }
00177 
00178 /** 
00179  *  Find the entry, or the one just before where it would go
00180  *
00181  * The ans array is populated with pointers to the skiplinks
00182  * at each level.
00183  *
00184  * @returns 1 if an exact match was found
00185  */
00186 static int
00187 ccny_skiplist_findbefore(struct ccn_nametree *h,
00188                          const unsigned char *key,
00189                          size_t size,
00190                          struct ccny **ans)
00191 {
00192     int i;
00193     struct ccny *c;
00194     struct ccny *y;
00195     int order = -1;
00196     ccn_nametree_compare cmp = h->compare;
00197     
00198     
00199     c = h->head;
00200     for (i = h->head->skipdim - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00201         for (;;) {
00202             y = c->skiplinks[i];
00203             if (y == NULL)
00204                 break;
00205             order = (*cmp)(y->key, y->keylen, key, size);
00206             if (order >= 0)
00207                 break;
00208             if (i >= y->skipdim) abort();
00209             c = y;
00210         }
00211         ans[i] = c;
00212     }
00213     return(order == 0);
00214 }
00215 
00216 /**
00217  *  Look for an entry with a key less than the given key
00218  *
00219  * When there are multiple possibilities, the one with the largest
00220  * key is returned.  Returns NULL if nothing matches.
00221  */
00222 struct ccny *
00223 ccn_nametree_look_lt(struct ccn_nametree *h,
00224                      const unsigned char *key, size_t size)
00225 {
00226     struct ccny *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00227     
00228     ccny_skiplist_findbefore(h, key, size, pred);
00229     if (pred[0] == h->head)
00230         return(NULL);
00231     return(pred[0]);
00232 }
00233 
00234 /**
00235  *  Look for an entry with a key less than or equal to the given key
00236  *
00237  * When there are multiple possibilities, the one with the largest
00238  * key is returned.  Returns NULL if nothing matches.
00239  */
00240 struct ccny *
00241 ccn_nametree_look_le(struct ccn_nametree *h,
00242                      const unsigned char *key, size_t size)
00243 {
00244     struct ccny *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00245     int found;
00246     
00247     found = ccny_skiplist_findbefore(h, key, size, pred);
00248     if (found)
00249         return(pred[0]->skiplinks[0]);
00250     if (pred[0] == h->head)
00251         return(NULL);
00252     return(pred[0]);
00253 }
00254 
00255 /**
00256  *  Look for an entry with a key equal to given key
00257  */
00258 struct ccny *
00259 ccn_nametree_lookup(struct ccn_nametree *h,
00260                     const unsigned char *key, size_t size)
00261 {
00262     struct ccny *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00263     int found;
00264     
00265     found = ccny_skiplist_findbefore(h, key, size, pred);
00266     if (found)
00267         return(pred[0]->skiplinks[0]);
00268     return(NULL);
00269 }
00270 
00271 /**
00272  *  Look for an entry with a key greater than or equal to the given key
00273  *
00274  * When there are multiple possibilities, the one with the smallest
00275  * key is returned.  Returns NULL if nothing matches.
00276  */
00277 struct ccny *
00278 ccn_nametree_look_ge(struct ccn_nametree *h,
00279                      const unsigned char *key, size_t size)
00280 {
00281     struct ccny *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00282     
00283     ccny_skiplist_findbefore(h, key, size, pred);
00284     return(pred[0]->skiplinks[0]);
00285 }
00286 
00287 /**
00288  *  Look for an entry with a key greater than the given key
00289  *
00290  * When there are multiple possibilities, the one with the smallest
00291  * key is returned.  Returns NULL if nothing matches.
00292  */
00293 struct ccny *
00294 ccn_nametree_look_gt(struct ccn_nametree *h,
00295                      const unsigned char *key, size_t size)
00296 {
00297     struct ccny *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00298     int found;
00299     
00300     found = ccny_skiplist_findbefore(h, key, size, pred);
00301     if (found)
00302         return(pred[0]->skiplinks[0]->skiplinks[0]);
00303     return(pred[0]->skiplinks[0]);
00304 }
00305 
00306 /**
00307  *  Insert an entry into the skiplist
00308  *
00309  * @returns old cookie and does not insert if an exact key match is found
00310  */
00311 static ccn_cookie
00312 ccny_skiplist_insert(struct ccn_nametree *h, struct ccny *y)
00313 {
00314     struct ccny *next = NULL;
00315     struct ccny *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00316     int found;
00317     int i;
00318     int d;
00319     int skipdim;
00320     
00321     d = y->skipdim;
00322     skipdim = h->head->skipdim;
00323     while (h->head->skipdim < d)
00324         h->head->skiplinks[h->head->skipdim++] = NULL;
00325     found = ccny_skiplist_findbefore(h, y->key, y->keylen, pred);
00326     if (found) {
00327         h->head->skipdim = skipdim;
00328         return(pred[0]->skiplinks[0]->cookie);
00329     }
00330     for (i = 0; i < d; i++) {
00331         y->skiplinks[i] = pred[i]->skiplinks[i];
00332         pred[i]->skiplinks[i] = y;
00333     }
00334     next = y->skiplinks[0];
00335     if (next == NULL)
00336         next = h->head;
00337     y->prev = next->prev;
00338     next->prev = y;
00339     return(0);
00340 }
00341 
00342 /**
00343  *  Remove an entry from the skiplist
00344  *
00345  * The entry must be present.
00346  */
00347 static void
00348 ccny_skiplist_remove(struct ccn_nametree *h, struct ccny *y)
00349 {
00350     struct ccny *next;
00351     struct ccny *prev;
00352     struct ccny *pred[CCN_SKIPLIST_MAX_DEPTH] = {NULL};
00353     int i;
00354     int d;
00355     
00356     next = y->skiplinks[0];
00357     if (next == NULL)
00358         next = h->head;
00359     prev = y->prev;
00360     d = y->skipdim;
00361     if (next->prev != y) abort();
00362     next->prev = prev;
00363     y->prev = NULL;
00364     if (d == 1 && prev != NULL) {
00365         prev->skiplinks[0] = y->skiplinks[0];
00366         y->skiplinks[0] = NULL;
00367         y->cookie = 0;
00368         return;
00369     }
00370     ccny_skiplist_findbefore(h, y->key, y->keylen, pred);
00371     if (pred[0]->skiplinks[0] != y) abort();
00372     d = y->skipdim;
00373     if (h->head->skipdim < d) abort();
00374     for (i = 0; i < d; i++) {
00375         pred[i]->skiplinks[i] = y->skiplinks[i];
00376         y->skiplinks[i] = NULL;
00377     }
00378     for (i = h->head->skipdim - 1; i > 0 && h->head->skiplinks[i] == NULL;)
00379         h->head->skipdim = i--;
00380     y->cookie = 0;
00381 }
00382 
00383 /**
00384  *  Enroll an entry into the nametree
00385  *
00386  * Although this detects a full table, caller should prevent that from ever
00387  * happening by trimming or resizing as appropriate, to maintain some
00388  * percentage of free slots.
00389  *
00390  * @returns cookie of old entry in the case that one with the old key is 
00391  *   present, or 0 upon success or a full table.  The latter case
00392  *   may be disambiguated by examining y->cookie.
00393  */
00394 ccn_cookie
00395 ccny_enroll(struct ccn_nametree *h, struct ccny *y)
00396 {
00397     ccn_cookie cookie;
00398     unsigned i;
00399     unsigned lastslot;
00400     ccn_cookie res;
00401     
00402     if (y->cookie != 0)
00403         abort();
00404     lastslot = h->cookie & h->cookiemask;
00405     for (;;) {
00406         cookie = ++(h->cookie);
00407         i = cookie & h->cookiemask;
00408         if (cookie != 0 && h->nmentry_by_cookie[i] == NULL) {
00409             y->cookie = cookie;
00410             res = ccny_skiplist_insert(h, y);
00411             if (res != 0) {
00412                 h->cookie--;
00413                 y->cookie = 0;
00414                 return(res);
00415             }
00416             h->nmentry_by_cookie[i] = y;
00417             h->n += 1;
00418             if (h->post_enroll)
00419                 (h->post_enroll)(h, y);
00420             return(0);
00421         }
00422         if (i == lastslot)
00423             return(0);
00424     }
00425 }
00426 
00427 /**
00428  *  Double the size of the direct lookup table
00429  *
00430  * @returns 0 for success, -1 for error.
00431  */
00432 int
00433 ccn_nametree_grow(struct ccn_nametree *h)
00434 {
00435     struct ccny **newtab = NULL;
00436     struct ccny *y = NULL;
00437     unsigned cookiemask;
00438     
00439     cookiemask = 2 * h->cookiemask + 1;
00440     if (cookiemask > (ccn_cookie)((~0U) / 2))
00441         return(-1);
00442     newtab = calloc(cookiemask + 1, sizeof(newtab[0]));
00443     if (newtab == NULL)
00444         return(-1);
00445     for (y = h->head->prev; y != NULL; y = y->prev)
00446         newtab[cookiemask & y->cookie] = y;
00447     free(h->nmentry_by_cookie);
00448     h->nmentry_by_cookie = newtab;
00449     h->cookiemask = cookiemask;
00450     h->limit = cookiemask - cookiemask / 4;
00451     return(0);
00452 }
00453 
00454 /**
00455  *  Remove y from the nametree
00456  *
00457  * If y is not in the nametree, nothing is changed.
00458  * On success, y->cookie is cleared, but y is not freed.
00459  */
00460 void
00461 ccny_remove(struct ccn_nametree *h, struct ccny *y)
00462 {
00463     unsigned i;
00464     
00465     if (y == NULL)
00466         return;
00467     if (y->cookie != 0) {
00468         i = y->cookie & h->cookiemask;
00469         if (h->nmentry_by_cookie[i] != y)
00470             return;
00471         if (h->pre_remove)
00472             (h->pre_remove)(h, y);
00473         ccny_skiplist_remove(h, y);
00474         y->cookie = 0;
00475         h->nmentry_by_cookie[i] = NULL;
00476         h->n -= 1;
00477     }
00478 }
00479 
00480 /**
00481  * Destroy a nametree entry
00482  *
00483  * The entry must not be in any nametree.
00484  */
00485 void
00486 ccny_destroy(struct ccn_nametree *h, struct ccny **py)
00487 {
00488     struct ccny *y = *py;
00489     if (y == NULL)
00490         return;
00491     if (y->cookie != 0) abort();
00492     if (h != NULL && h->finalize)
00493         (h->finalize)(h, y);
00494     if (y->key != NULL)
00495         free(y->key);
00496     free(y);
00497     *py = NULL;
00498 }
00499 
00500 /**
00501  * Destroy a nametree, deleting all entries
00502  */
00503 void
00504 ccn_nametree_destroy(struct ccn_nametree **ph)
00505 {
00506     struct ccny *x;
00507     struct ccny *y;
00508     struct ccn_nametree *h = *ph;
00509     
00510     if (h == NULL)
00511         return;
00512     for (y = h->head->prev; y != NULL; y = x) {
00513         x = y->prev;
00514         ccny_remove(h, y);
00515         ccny_destroy(h, &y);
00516     }
00517     if (h->nmentry_by_cookie != NULL)
00518         free(h->nmentry_by_cookie);
00519     free(h->head);
00520     *ph = NULL;
00521     free(h);
00522 }
00523 
00524 /** Check the nametree for consistency */
00525 void
00526 ccn_nametree_check(struct ccn_nametree *h)
00527 {
00528     int i, n;
00529     struct ccny *y = NULL;
00530     struct ccny *z = NULL;
00531     
00532     for (n = 0, i = 0; i <= h->cookiemask; i++) {
00533         y = h->nmentry_by_cookie[i];
00534         if (y == NULL)
00535             continue;
00536         if (y->cookie == 0) abort();
00537         if ((y->cookie & h->cookiemask) != i) abort();
00538         if (y != ccny_from_cookie(h, y->cookie)) abort();
00539         n++;
00540     }
00541     if (n != h->n) abort();
00542     if (n > h->limit) abort();
00543     if (h->limit > h->cookiemask) abort();
00544     for (n = 0, y = h->head->prev; y != NULL; y = y->prev) {
00545         if (y->prev != NULL) {
00546             if ((h->compare)(y->prev->key, y->prev->keylen,
00547                              y->key, y->keylen) >= 0) abort();
00548             if (y != y->prev->skiplinks[0]) abort();
00549         }
00550         else {
00551             if (y != h->head->skiplinks[0]) abort();
00552         }
00553         if (ccn_nametree_look_lt(h, y->key, y->keylen) != y->prev) abort();
00554         if (ccn_nametree_look_le(h, y->key, y->keylen) != y) abort();
00555         n++;
00556     }
00557     if (n != h->n) abort();
00558     for (n = 0, y = h->head->skiplinks[0]; y != NULL; y = y->skiplinks[0]) {
00559         for (i = 0; i < y->skipdim; i++) {
00560             z = y->skiplinks[i];
00561             if (z != NULL) {
00562                 if ((h->compare)(y->key, y->keylen,
00563                                  z->key, z->keylen) >= 0) abort();
00564             }
00565         }
00566         z = y->skiplinks[0];
00567         if (ccn_nametree_look_gt(h, y->key, y->keylen) != z) abort();
00568         if (ccn_nametree_look_ge(h, y->key, y->keylen) != y) abort();
00569         n++;
00570     }
00571     if (n != h->n) abort();
00572     for (i = 1; i < h->head->skipdim; i++)
00573         if (h->head->skiplinks[i] == NULL) abort();
00574     if (h->check) {
00575         for (y = h->head->skiplinks[0]; y != NULL; y = y->skiplinks[0])
00576             (h->check)(h, y);
00577     }
00578 }

00667 /** Get the last entry */
00668 struct ccny *
00669 ccn_nametree_last(struct ccn_nametree *h)
00670 {
00671     return(h->head->prev);
